lossy_transformations.description: Each format necessarily loses some information while gaining others

philosophical_implications.observation_1: No single format captures complete truth
philosophical_implications.observation_2: All formats are equally 'true' within their paradigm
philosophical_implications.observation_3: The combination of formats approaches fuller understanding
philosophical_implications.observation_4: Format choice is a political act - it determines what counts as knowledge
philosophical_implications.observation_5: Translation between formats reveals hidden assumptions
philosophical_implications.synthesis: Truth is not a single encoding but a family of valid perspectives. The Rosetta Tick demonstrates that the same reality can be faithfully represented in radically different ways, each revealing aspects invisible to others. Choosing a format is choosing what matters.

usage_recommendations.for_wisdom: All five together - truth emerges from the intersection

meta_observation.note: This comparison_matrix.json is itself a sixth encoding - a meta-format that describes the relationships between formats. It is no more 'objective' than the others; it simply operates at a different level of abstraction.
meta_observation.recursion_warning: A comparison matrix of comparison matrices would require a seventh format, and so on. At some point, we must simply live within our chosen representations.
